faq.ques: Why do you say that your products are chemical-free?
faq.ans: Our core mission is to provide chemical-free, unadulterated food to consumers. We take great pains to ensure that we go directly to the fishermen or farmers without any middlemen in between and buy the freshest of fresh food straight from the source.

faq.ques: How the fish, vegetables, fruits is weighed?
faq.ans: The fish is weighted before cutting, cleaning & descaling. After cutting, cleaning & descaling actual weight of the fish will be less than the weight shown in website/app. Weight loss varies from 10-35% in respect to different fishes. In case of fruits, vegetables weight will be exact or greater than the weight shown. We do not charge any extra for money for higher in weight than the weight shown in the website/app.

faq.ques: How do I change my shipping address?
faq.ans: First you have to login, then go to My Account section, then click on personal details, then go to change address, add new address & save it. Make this your new default address.

read.title: The right quality
read.desc: The skin should be bright and shiny with close-fitting scales. Dry, dull flesh and loose scales are signs of age. The eyes should be clear and bulging; if the fish has sunken or cloudy eyes, look for a fresher specimen. Gills should be reddish and damp, not sticky.

read.title: The right time
read.desc: Really high and really low water temperatures reduce the amount of oxygen in the water, making fish less active and picky about when and what they eat. When it comes to finding the best fishing times, a good starting point is to avoid extreme temperatures.

read.title: The basis of a balanced diet
read.desc: Fish is filled with omega-3 fatty acids and vitamins such as D and B2 (riboflavin). Fish is rich in calcium and phosphorus and a great source of minerals, such as iron, zinc, iodine, magnesium, and potassium. The American Heart Association recommends eating fish at least two times per week as part of a healthy diet.

topics.title: TOPICS YOU CAN'T MISS
topics.desc: All foods, including seafood, must be handled and prepared in a clean area to avoid cross-contamination. Always remember to keep your hands, preperation area and utensils clean. All fresh shell fish should be stored in an open container in the refrigerator. Place a damp towel on top to maintain humidity. Never store shellfish in water. They will die and may spoil

topics.title: HOW TO CLEAN/CUT YOUR SEAFOOD
topics.desc: The seafood should be cleaned properly before cooking. For doing so, first of all, you need to spread the body open and remove all of the entrails, locate the fishs anus and cut this out in a 'v' or notch shape. Some fish have a kidney by the backbone. Remove it by swaping it out with a spoon or your thumbnail. Rinse the cavity out with a good stream of water and wash the skin.
